score.explanation: The Wi-Fi network is moderately congested with random dropouts. This can impact overall connectivity and performance.
score.trend_summary: Since last scan: download stayed the same, upload stayed the same, ping stayed the same, networks stayed the same.

latest_report.diagnosis: Random dropouts are likely due to network congestion and interference from neighboring networks. The placement of the router may also contribute to the issue.

performance.interpretation: Speedtest results were inaccessible due to restrictions, so performance metrics are unavailable.

problems: 1. High congestion in the 2.4GHz band causing interference and dropouts.
2. Suboptimal channel usage in both bands.
3. Possible router placement issues affecting signal strength.
fixes: Change the 2.4GHz channel to 6 (least congested option).
Change the 5GHz channel to 149 (for better performance based on congestion analysis).
Consider relocating the router away from the window for improved signal distribution throughout your home.
Ensure that Smart Connect (if available) is enabled to allow automatic band steering.
Limit the number of devices actively using high bandwidth at the same time.
